content.p: For tax year two thousand\nthirteen, the commissioner, not later than September first, two thousand\ntwelve, shall multiply the amounts specified in subsection
of this\nsection for tax year two thousand twelve by one plus the cost of living\nadjustment described in subsection

of this section. For tax year two
thousand fourteen, the commissioner, not later than September first, two
thousand thirteen, shall multiply the amounts specified in subsection

of this section for tax year two thousand thirteen by one plus the
cost of living adjustment. For each succeeding tax year after tax year
two thousand fourteen and before tax year two thousand eighteen, the
commissioner, not later than September first of such tax year, shall
multiply the amounts specified in subsection
of this section for\nsuch tax year by one plus the cost of living adjustment described in\nsubsection
of this section for such tax year.\n
The following amounts shall be indexed by the cost of living\nadjustment.\n
The dollar amounts in the tax tables set forth in paragraph one of\nsubsection
of section six hundred one of this part.\n
The dollar amount in the numerator of the fractions in subsection\n
of section six hundred one of this part that is not fifty thousand\ndollars.\n
The New York standard deduction of a resident individual in\nsection six hundred fourteen of this article.\n

The cost of living adjustment for a tax year is the percentage if
any, by which the average monthly value of the consumer price index for
the twelve month period ending on June thirtieth of the year immediately
preceding the tax year for which the adjustment is being made (referred
to as the adjustment year) exceeds the average monthly value of the
consumer price index for the twelve month period ending on June
thirtieth of the year immediately preceding the adjustment year. For
purposes of this section, the consumer price index means the consumer
price index for all urban consumers published by the United States
department of labor.
If the product of the amounts in subsection

of this section is not a multiple of fifty dollars, such increase shall
be rounded to the next lowest multiple of fifty dollars.
